The post What is the Return Policy for GOTRAX products? appeared first on GOTRAX.
item.content:encoded:
Customer satisfaction is mission critical for the GOTRAX team which is why all our products come a 30-day no hassles return policy.

GOTRAX only processes returns and refunds for products ordered directly from GOTRAX.com. Citizens wanting to return a product or seeking a refund from an authorized dealer in store or online should consult the original retailer.

Generally, GOTRAX will accept return of new, unused products ordered from the website within 30 calendar days. Items must be sent back in their GOTRAX original packaging and postmarked within 30 days of the original receipt. Give us at least two weeks to process your request. Our Commanders and Mission Support Specialists are the best in the galaxy, but they sometimes still need a bit of time to make sure everything is in order.

Take note, Citizens! As much as your satisfaction is a vital part of the GOTRAX mission, failure to follow instructions could result in delay and affect refund eligibility. Step-by-step instructions can be found in our Return Guidelines at GOTRAX.com/support/gotrax-return-policy.

For returns or refunds from other authorized retailers, whether online or in-store, contact the original seller for more information.

item.title: How Do I Charge the Battery in My GLIDER Electric Scooter?
item.dc:creator: Diandra
item.description:
Following the battery charging instructions below will ensure the safety of you and others and the proper operation of your […]

The post How Do I Charge the Battery in My GLIDER Electric Scooter? appeared first on GOTRAX.
item.content:encoded:
Following the battery charging instructions below will ensure the safety of you and others and the proper operation of your GOTRAX GLIDER Electric Scooter.

  • After the removal of all packaging, plug the provided charger and adapter into a grounded outlet (100V-240V; 50-60Hz).
  • Plug the other end of the charger / adapter into the battery charging port of the GOTRAX GLIDER located below the power button towards the top of
    the handlebars behind a black rubber cover. The indicator light will turn to red to confirm that the product is charging.
  • The GLIDER battery will take approximately 3 hours to fully charge.
  • The GLIDER battery is fully charged when the indicator light changes from red to green.
  • Detach the charger / adapter from the GOTRAX GLIDER before turning on or operating.

Always adhere to the safety warnings in the GOTRAX GLIDER Commander’s Manual when charging your battery.

The post How Do I Charge the Battery in My GLIDER Electric Scooter? appeared first on GOTRAX.

Looking inside a self-balancing scooter is a great way to see how far technology has come. Human technology used to be slow, clunky and powered by steam.

Now, we have miniature batteries and computers in everything, making our lives so much more comfortable. Something like hoverboards would be impossible a mere 100 years ago, but now any Earthling can buy their very own GOTRAX HOVERFLY.

There’s so much going on in a hoverboard that you wouldn’t believe it unless you saw it with your own eyes. So, now we’re going to take a peek inside a hoverboard and explain what’s there. If you’re the kind of inquisitive person who enjoys taking things apart, you’ll like this look at what’s inside a self-balancing scooter.

item.title: Can a Hoverboard go in snow?
item.dc:creator: Vasanth
item.description:
You know, we don’t get that much snow on this side of the Milky Way. But from what we understand […]

The post Can a Hoverboard go in snow? appeared first on GOTRAX.
item.content:encoded:
You know, we don’t get that much snow on this side of the Milky Way. But from what we understand about the general physics on Earth, snow is a solid version of rain. So the answer is a resounding no.

Since snow is classified as wet weather, we recommend you leave the hoverboard at home base in the winter. GOTRAX self-balancing scooters are only designed only for dry weather. Operating and riding HOVERFLY hoverboards in the rain or on wet ground can increase the risk of injury due to falling off or losing control. It can also risk damaging the battery.

Check out the Safe Riding Guidelines in the Commander’s Manual for more information on how to protect yourself and your board while orbiting around the neighborhood.

item.title: What kind of battery does GOTRAX use for its hoverboards?
item.dc:creator: hkskewes@gmail.com
item.description:
How do I charge my HOVERFLY? When is it fully charged? The GOTRAX Command Center uses space-age technology to power […]

The post What kind of battery does GOTRAX use for its hoverboards? appeared first on GOTRAX.
item.content:encoded:
How do I charge my HOVERFLY? When is it fully charged?

The GOTRAX Command Center uses space-age technology to power its hoverboards! We provide all the equipment you need to cruise the cosmos, including battery and charger.

The GOTRAX HOVERFLY and HOVERFLY PLUS use lithium ion batteries both for its power and because it can be recharged. All GOTRAX products with lithium ion batteries are safety-tested and certified under UL 2272.

Only use the charging cable provided to charge your hoverboard! Once you plug it in, a red light on the box located along the charging cable will let you know it’s charging, which should only take about an hour. Never leave it plugged in for longer than that. The light will turn green once it’s fully charged.

You’ll also see a yellow light on the hoverboard itself when you connect it to the charger. That light simply means the hoverboard is connected to the charger.

With a full battery, you can cosmic fun glide for miles before returning to the Space Station to recharge!

item.title: What are the differences between the HOVERFLY hoverboards?
item.dc:creator: Jamie
item.description:
The flight engineers at GOTRAX recognize that different people have different needs.  What works for one person may not work […]

The post What are the differences between the HOVERFLY hoverboards? appeared first on GOTRAX.
item.content:encoded:
The flight engineers at GOTRAX recognize that different people have different needs.  What works for one person may not work for others.  And so they’ve developed different HOVERFLY hoverboards to meet those different needs.

The GOTRAX HOVERFLY is a two-wheel self-balancing scooter aka hoverboard. This self-balancing scooter features two riding modes, battery light indicators, system light indicators, and safety features including non-slip foot platforms and Auto Shutdown.

The GOTRAX HOVERFLY ECO is our most affordable two-wheel self-balancing scooter aka hoverboard. This self-balancing scooter features two riding modes, battery light indicators, system light indicators, and safety features including non-slip foot platforms and Auto Shutdown.

The HOVERFLY PLUS is a variation of the HOVERFLY self-balancing scooter that has everything that the HOVERFLY features plus a Bluetooth speaker and mobile app with a third riding mode – the Pro Riding Mode, which is for advanced riders only.

The HOVERFLY XL is a variation of the HOVERFLY PLUS self-balancing scooter that has everything that the HOVERFLY PLUS features but with 8-inch tires for all-terrain riding. Like the HOVERFLY PLUS, the HOVERFLY XL boasts a Bluetooth speaker and mobile app with an extra Pro Riding Mode.

Light-years of fun await! Enter the GOTRAX GALAXY now, and shop our HOVERFLY hoverboards.

item.dc:creator: The Firm Web
item.description:
Before you try to bring you hoverboard on an airplane, let us give you the lowdown on this! All GOTRAX […]

The post Can I bring my hoverboard on an airplane? appeared first on GOTRAX.
item.content:encoded:
Before you try to bring you hoverboard on an airplane, let us give you the lowdown on this!

All GOTRAX rideables are prohibited in checked baggage when traveling by plane due to their batteries. After all, with top-ranking torque comes a powerful battery.

The Federal Aviation Administration Office of Hazardous Materials Safety recommends that passengers get permission from the individual airline for devices that contain lithium-ion batteries that have a higher watt-hour than say a cell phone, tablet, tool, camera, PDA, or laptop would have. The GOTRAX products will likely fall in this category. The FAA bases these guidelines on US DOT regulations.

To find more information on these guidelines head over www.faa.gov.

The FAA also advises that the TSA security, as well as individual airlines and international rules, can sometimes be tougher when it comes to these sorts of things.

We know you love your HOVERFLY Hoverboard and want to show your friends, cousins, and first cousins twice removed, but we say skip the potential hassle and leave your prized GOTRAX product at home. This way, you can prevent any potential headaches that may result from trying to take your hoverboard on an airplane. You don’t want to miss your flight because you have to run your HOVERFLY Hoverboard or GLIDER Electric Scooter back to your home base.

The post Can I bring my hoverboard on an airplane? appeared first on GOTRAX.
